translated: Therefore, it is long.

original: tum\ mtha'i byings las @164a * //
analyzed: tum\ mtha'i byings las @164a * //
translated: From the root tuṃ

original: las dang 'dod pa dang byed pa po gcig can las yang na'o //
analyzed: las dang 'dod pa dang byed pa po gcig can las yang na'o //
translated: it is from the same action, desire, and agent as the root tuṃ.

original: gang gi mtha' tu ma yin pa de tum\ mtha'o //
analyzed: gang gi mtha' tu ma yin pa de tum\ mtha'o //
translated: That which is not at the end is tuṃ. The end is tuṃ.

original: gang gi byed pa po gcig yin pa de ni byed pa po gcig can te /
analyzed: gang gi byed pa po gcig yin pa de ni byed pa po gcig can te /
translated: That which has one agent is one-agent.

original: bsdu ba'i mthar gyur pa zhes pas bsdu ba'i mtha' la aa yig go //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i mthar gyur pa zhes pas bsdu ba'i mtha' la aa yig go //
translated: The final letter of the collection is the letter A.

original: tum\'i mtha'i byings las las 'dod pa dang byed pa po gcig can dang bcas pa la yan yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tum\'i mtha'i byings las las 'dod pa dang byed pa po gcig can dang bcas pa la yan yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: From the root tum, which means 'to desire' and 'to have one agent', the affix ya is added.

original: bhoktu mitstsha ti /
analyzed: bhoktu mitstsha ti /
translated: Bhoktumicchati.

original: bu bhuksha te /
analyzed: bu bhuksha te /
translated: Bhuksate.

original: bhu dza skyong ba dang za ba la'o //
analyzed: bhu dza skyong ba dang za ba la'o //
translated: Bhuja means 'to protect' and 'to eat'.

original: 'dod pa'i don rnams la byed pa po gcig pa rnams la tu ma'o zhes pas tuma'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rnams la byed pa po gcig pa rnams la tu ma'o zhes pas tuma'o //
translated: Since 'those who have one agent with regard to desired objects' is tum, it is tum.

original: au pa dh'a n'a mi na'i'ang yang ba'i 'o zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: au pa dh'a n'a mi na'i'ang yang ba'i 'o zhes pas yon tan no //
translated: Since 'the quality of being light' is also upa-dhana-ni, it is a quality.

original: tsa sde'i ki'o ;
analyzed: tsa sde'i ki'o ;
translated: The kta affix of the ca class.

original: /'dis tu ma'i mtha' la\s san'o //
analyzed: /'dis tu ma'i mtha' la\s san'o //
translated: By this, the final letter of tum is san.

original: dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi san la'o zhes pa'i shas par byed pa las tum\ mi 'jug go //
analyzed: dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi san la'o zhes pa'i shas par byed pa las tum\ mi 'jug go //
translated: Since it is said that 'the san of the final vowels is la', the tum does not enter.

original: mi 'jug pa de la rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can yang med do zhes pas yon tan la sogs pa'i bya ba yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa de la rgyu mtshan med na rgyu mtshan can yang med do zhes pas yon tan la sogs pa'i bya ba yang mi 'jug go //
translated: Since there is no reason for not entering, there is also no reason for entering. Thus, the action of quality and so forth also does not enter.

original: des na bhu dza la sana'o zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na bhu dza la sana'o zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is bhūṣa.

original: tsa na pa ro& ksha zhes pa gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: tsa na pa ro& ksha zhes pa gnyis brjod do //
translated: The two ca and pa are pronounced.

original: gnyis pa bzhi pa dag ces pas bha'i ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa bzhi pa dag ces pas bha'i ba'o //
translated: The second and fourth are pronounced as bha.

original: tsa sde'i ki'o //
analyzed: tsa sde'i ki'o //
translated: The ca class is ki.

original: sha nyid do //
analyzed: sha nyid do //
translated: It is śa itself.

original: phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la /
translated: In one part,

original: bhiktu mitstsha ti zhes pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bhiktu mitstsha ti zhes pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes bhikṣati, etc.

original: 'dir 'dod pa bya ba dang za ba las la byed pa po gcig yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa bya ba dang za ba las la byed pa po gcig yod pa'o //
translated: Here, there is one agent in the action of desiring and eating.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na 'dod pa do kho na za ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na 'dod pa do kho na za ba'o //
translated: Thus, the one who desires is the one who eats.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: kartu mitstsha ti /🔽tsi k'irsha ti /
analyzed: kartu mitstsha ti / tsi k'irsha ti /
translated: kartum icchati.🔽cīrṣati.

original: du krinya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: du krinya byed pa la'o //
translated: duḥkṛt.

original: snga ma bzhin du tu ma sogs kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du tu ma sogs kyi bya ba'o //
translated: The action of tuma, etc. is as before.

original: de nas sana'o //
analyzed: de nas sana'o //
translated: Then, san.

original: thams cad du snga ma bzhin du tum mi 'jug go //
analyzed: thams cad du snga ma bzhin du tum mi 'jug go //
translated: Everywhere, tuma does not enter as before.

original: dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi san la'o zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi san la'o zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long one is by san of the final vowels.

original: rit mtha'i yon tan med pa la ai ra'o zhes pas aira'o //
analyzed: rit mtha'i yon tan med pa la ai ra'o zhes pas aira'o //
translated: The ai of the final rit is pronounced as irau by the absence of the quality.

original: n'a mina'i ra ba dag la zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: n'a mina'i ra ba dag la zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long one is by narāmiṇī rava.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: The two are pronounced.

original: ka sde'i tsa sde'o //
analyzed: ka sde'i tsa sde'o //
translated: The class ka, the class ca.

original: sha nyid do //🔽drishtu mitstsha ti /🔽di driksha te /
analyzed: sha nyid do // drishtu mitstsha ti / di driksha te /
translated: It is śa.🔽It is dṛṣṭu miṣṭi.🔽It is dṛkṣate.

original: dri shing lta ba la'o //
analyzed: dri shing lta ba la'o //
translated: It is dṛśi.🔽The a of bṛj and dṛś are āgama.

original: tum\'o // bri dzi dang dri sha dag gi a'a gam zhes pas aa yig a'a ga ma'o ;
analyzed: tum\'o // bri dzi dang dri sha dag gi a'a gam zhes pas aa yig a'a ga ma'o ;
translated: It is ra.🔽The a of śa and ṣa are also.

original: / ra nyid do //🔽tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha nyid do //
analyzed: / ra nyid do // tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha nyid do //
translated: It is śa.

original: sha dang ta sde las ta sde'i zhes pas ta'i ta'o //
analyzed: sha dang ta sde las ta sde'i zhes pas ta'i ta'o //
translated: The ta of śa and the ta class are ta.

original: tu ma'i mtha' la yana'o //
analyzed: tu ma'i mtha' la yana'o //
translated: The ya of tuma is at the end.

original: snga ma bzhin du tum\ ldog cing log pa de la aa yig a'a ga ma sogs kyang ldog go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du tum\ ldog cing log pa de la aa yig a'a ga ma sogs kyang ldog go //
translated: As before, tuma is reversed. The a of āgama and so on are also reversed.

original: gnyis brjod do //🔽ri'i yi ge aa yig go //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do // ri'i yi ge aa yig go //
translated: It is said twice.🔽The letter of ri is the letter a.

original: @164b san la aa'i yi ge zhes pas ai yig go //🔽tsha sha dag go 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
analyzed: @164b san la aa'i yi ge zhes pas ai yig go // tsha sha dag go 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
translated: The letter of san is the letter ai.🔽The a of śa and ṣa are also.🔽It is śa.

original: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
translated: The sa of śa and ṣha is sa.

original: dri sha las san mtha' la ru tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir a'atma ne'i tshig go //
analyzed: dri sha las san mtha' la ru tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir a'atma ne'i tshig go //
translated: The sa of dṛś is at the end of san. Because of ruca and so on, it is the word ātmane.

original: las la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: las la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the case?

original: ga ma ne ne tstsha ti /
analyzed: ga ma ne ne tstsha ti /
translated: It is gama ne ne cchati.

original: gal te tum\'i mtha' med pa'i phyir 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tum\'i mtha' med pa'i phyir 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not apply here because the end of the alternatives is endless,

original: 'on kyang phyi ma'i don du las smos so //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi ma'i don du las smos so //
translated: nevertheless, it is mentioned for the sake of the future.

original: tu ma'i mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tu ma'i mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “from the end of the alternatives”?

original: bho dza na motstsha ti /
analyzed: bho dza na motstsha ti /
translated: bhojanamicchati.

original: 'dod pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “desire”?

original: pathi tum dz'a n'a ti /
analyzed: pathi tum dz'a n'a ti /
translated: patitumicchati.

original: sa ka bri sha zhes pas tu ma'o //
analyzed: sa ka bri sha zhes pas tu ma'o //
translated: sakṛt means “alternative.”

original: 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la byed pa po gcig can smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la byed pa po gcig can smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don to ;
translated: In “from desire,” the mention of a single agent is for the sake of clarifying the form.

original: / de ba datta sya bho dza na mi tstsha ti /
analyzed: / de ba datta sya bho dza na mi tstsha ti /
translated: devadattaḥ bhojanamicchati.

original: yadznya datta:/ zhes pa 'dir tu ma'i mtha' nyid med pas bhu dza la sana'i rkyen med do //
analyzed: yadznya datta:/ zhes pa 'dir tu ma'i mtha' nyid med pas bhu dza la sana'i rkyen med do //
translated: Here, since there is no end of the alternatives, there is no condition of san for bhuj.

original: 'dod pa las na mtha' las san mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dod pa las na mtha' las san mi 'dod de /
translated: From desire, san is not desired from the end.

original: a'irshi tu mitstsha ti /
analyzed: a'irshi tu mitstsha ti /
translated: īrṣyitumicchati.

original: gzhan la ni san\ mtha' las 'gyur ba ste /🔽dzu gupsi tu mi tstsha ti /
analyzed: gzhan la ni san\ mtha' las 'gyur ba ste / dzu gupsi tu mi tstsha ti /
translated: In the other, san is from the end.🔽jugupsitumicchati.

original: dzu gupsi sha te /
analyzed: dzu gupsi sha te /
translated: jugupsitaḥ.

original: dzu gu pa'i sgra las /
analyzed: dzu gu pa'i sgra las /
translated: From the word jugupsa.

original: byings las yang na las la zhes pas sana'o //
analyzed: byings las yang na las la zhes pas sana'o //
translated: san is from the root or from the affix.

original: aita'o // aa'i 'ang dbyi'o zhes pas dam yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: aita'o // aa'i 'ang dbyi'o zhes pas dam yig dbyi'o //
translated: And aitau means the vowel a.

original: snga ma bzhin du san mtha' las zhes pas a'atma ne'i tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du san mtha' las zhes pas a'atma ne'i tshig go //
translated: As before, santam means atman.

original: dogs pa la san yang na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dogs pa la san yang na bshad par bya ste /
translated: In the case of doubt, san should be explained.

original: ku k'u la pa ti shya t'i tye ba ma hya m'a sham ke k'u lam si sa ti sha ti /
analyzed: ku k'u la pa ti shya t'i tye ba ma hya m'a sham ke k'u lam si sa ti sha ti /
translated: Kukkula-patisyatîty eva mahyamâśaṅka kuklaṃ sastiḥ.

original: pa ti'i lig gi pusha sogs dyu ta zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa ti'i lig gi pusha sogs dyu ta zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Patilīka-puṣpâdyudgata iti means the meaning of the word.

original: san ste bshad pa las so //
analyzed: san ste bshad pa las so //
translated: San means from the explanation.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: It is said twice.

original: san la aa'i yi ge'i'o zhes pas ai nyid do //
analyzed: san la aa'i yi ge'i'o zhes pas ai nyid do //
translated: San means the letter ai.

original: ai ta'o // shv'a ma r'i shya ti tye ba ma hya m'a sham ke / shv'a mu m'ursha ti /
analyzed: ai ta'o // shv'a ma r'i shya ti tye ba ma hya m'a sham ke / shv'a mu m'ursha ti /
translated: It is ai. Śvāmâriśyâti ty eva mahyamâśaṅka śvâmuṃ mūrṣati.

original: ming srog gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: ming srog gcod pa la'o //
translated: The name is for killing.

original: sana'o // dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi san la zhes pas ring po'o //🔽mchur gyur au pa dh'a'i zhes pas au ra'o //
analyzed: sana'o // dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi san la zhes pas ring po'o // mchur gyur au pa dh'a'i zhes pas au ra'o //
translated: San means the long vowel of the last vowel.🔽 Upadhâ means the long u.

original: n'a mina'i ra pa dag la zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: n'a mina'i ra pa dag la zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: Namînîrapa means the long vowel.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: It is said twice.

original: thung ngu'o // ming las bdag nyid 'dod pa la yin no //
analyzed: thung ngu'o // ming las bdag nyid 'dod pa la yin no //
translated: It is short. It is for the desire of the self in the name.

original: ming las te rtags las las la bdag nyid 'dod pa'i don la yin yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming las te rtags las las la bdag nyid 'dod pa'i don la yin yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: From the name, from the sign, from the action, the self is desired in the object.

original: phu tri ya ti /
analyzed: phu tri ya ti /
translated: Putriya-ti

original: pa t'i ya ti /
analyzed: pa t'i ya ti /
translated: Patīya-ti

original: bu 'dod pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bu 'dod pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The self is desired as a son.

original: snam bu 'dod pa'i bdag nyid do zhes pas yina'o //🔽aa yig dang na yig dag ni yin la aa'i yi ge'i zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snam bu 'dod pa'i bdag nyid do zhes pas yina'o // aa yig dang na yig dag ni yin la aa'i yi ge'i zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The self is desired as a cloth.🔽The letter a and the letter na are the meaning of the letter ā.

original: yin la aa'i yi ge'i a'i nyid do //
analyzed: yin la aa'i yi ge'i a'i nyid do //
translated: The letter a and the letter ā are the nature of ā.

original: barta m'a n'a'i ti'o //
analyzed: barta m'a n'a'i ti'o //
translated: Bartā-mā-nati

original: aan\ bi / @165a * //
analyzed: aan\ bi / @165a * //
translated: Anvi

original: phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la /
translated: In one part.

original: pu tra mitstsha tyatma na:/
analyzed: pu tra mitstsha tyatma na:/
translated: Putram icchati

original: zhes sogs kyi ngag go //
analyzed: zhes sogs kyi ngag go //
translated: And so on is the statement.

original: ming la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ming la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What about the name?

original: byings las mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings las mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not come from the root.

original: a'atma na:paktu mitstsha ti /
analyzed: a'atma na:paktu mitstsha ti /
translated: Ātmanah paktum icchati

original: las smos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: las smos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What about the mention of action?

original: a'atma na:bu tri netstsha ti /
analyzed: a'atma na:bu tri netstsha ti /
translated: Ātmanah putram icchati

original: ci ste / r'a dza su tra mi tstsha ti zhes pa 'dir ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste / r'a dza su tra mi tstsha ti zhes pa 'dir ci'i phyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: But why is this not so in Rājasūtramicchati?

original: 'dir bdag nyid 'dod pa yod pas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir bdag nyid 'dod pa yod pas so zhe na /
translated: Because the self is desired here.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dir bdag nyid gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bdag nyid gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, the self is not the object of grasping.

original: 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kho na ni srid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kho na ni srid do //
translated: Only the desired self is possible.

original: des na bdag nyid gzung ba'i nus pa las gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyi don cung zad 'dod pa de'i tshe rkyen no //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid gzung ba'i nus pa las gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyi don cung zad 'dod pa de'i tshe rkyen no //
translated: Therefore, when one desires even the slightest benefit for the self, due to the capacity of grasping the self, at that time it is a condition.

original: des na / r'adznya:/
analyzed: des na / r'adznya:/
translated: Thus, the word self is not changed to rajn.

original: putra mitstsha ti /
analyzed: putra mitstsha ti /
translated: The word son is not changed to mitcha.

original: zhes pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this is not changed.

original: ma mtha' dang mi zad pa dag las mi 'dod de /🔽ai da mitstsha ty'atma na:/
analyzed: ma mtha' dang mi zad pa dag las mi 'dod de / ai da mitstsha ty'atma na:/
translated: The words minimum and inexhaustible are not desired,🔽because idam mitcha tatnam

original: autstshe ri tstsha ty'a tma na:/🔽na mas\ las mchod pa'i don la yin\ bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: autstshe ri tstsha ty'a tma na:/ na mas\ las mchod pa'i don la yin\ bshad par bya ste /
translated: and utscha mitcha tatnam🔽are for the meaning of worship.

original: na ma sya ti tri ne tram /
analyzed: na ma sya ti tri ne tram /
translated: The word nama is for the meaning of worship.🔽The word varibhasya is for thorough analysis.

original: ba ri bas las yongs su dpyod pa la'o //🔽ba ri ba sya ti tu tram /
analyzed: ba ri bas las yongs su dpyod pa la'o // ba ri ba sya ti tu tram /
translated: The word varibhasya is for thorough analysis.

original: tsi trang ngo mtshar ba la'o //
analyzed: tsi trang ngo mtshar ba la'o //
translated: The word citra is for wonder.

original: nga yig ni a'atma ne'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: nga yig ni a'atma ne'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The letter a is the meaning of the word atman.

original: tsi tri ya to yin la aa'i yi ge zhes pas a'i nyid do //
analyzed: tsi tri ya to yin la aa'i yi ge zhes pas a'i nyid do //
translated: The word citrayato is citra, and the letter ai is ai.

original: aa shva dang bri sha dag 'khrig pa 'dod pa can las yig a'a ga ma dang po can gyi yin bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: aa shva dang bri sha dag 'khrig pa 'dod pa can las yig a'a ga ma dang po can gyi yin bshad par bya'o //
translated: The words aśva and bṛśa are said to be from one desiring sex, with the first āgamap affix.

original: kshi ra dang la ba na dag ni 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: kshi ra dang la ba na dag ni 'dod pa la'o //
translated: The words kṣīra and lavaṇa are from desire.

original: 'dod pa ni shin tu mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni shin tu mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is a strong longing.

original: aa shva sya ti ba da b'a bri sha sya ti goo:/
analyzed: aa shva sya ti ba da b'a bri sha sya ti goo:/
translated: Aśvasya tivādavṛṣasya goḥ.

original: 'dir ai nyid med par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ai nyid med par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here the i is said to be absent.

original: kshi ra sya ti m'a na ba ka:/
analyzed: kshi ra sya ti m'a na ba ka:/
translated: Kṣīrasya mānabakah.

original: la ba na sya ti aushta:/
analyzed: la ba na sya ti aushta:/
translated: Lavaṇasya uṣṭaḥ.

original: ming las 'dod pa las yig a'a ga ma dang po can gyi yin bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ming las 'dod pa las yig a'a ga ma dang po can gyi yin bshad par bya ste /
translated: The words are said to be from desire, with the first āgamap affix.

original: zho 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: zho 'dod pa ni /
translated: One desiring yogurt

original: da dhya sya ti /
analyzed: da dhya sya ti /
translated: is dadhyasya ti.

original: sa a'a ga ma dang po'o zhes pas gzhan la ni zho 'dod do //
analyzed: sa a'a ga ma dang po'o zhes pas gzhan la ni zho 'dod do //
translated: With the first āgamap, it is said to be desiring yogurt.

original: da dhi shya ti /
analyzed: da dhi shya ti /
translated: Dadhiśya ti.

original: k'a mya'ang ngo //
analyzed: k'a mya'ang ngo //
translated: It is also desire.

original: ming la bdag nyid 'dod pa la zhes ba 'jug go //
analyzed: ming la bdag nyid 'dod pa la zhes ba 'jug go //
translated: The word is said to be from one desiring oneself.

original: ming las las la bdag nyid 'dod pa'i don la k'a mya'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming las las la bdag nyid 'dod pa'i don la k'a mya'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the word, the affix kām is formed for the meaning of desiring oneself.🔽One desiring a son

original: bu 'dod pa'i bdag nyid ni /🔽pu tra k'a mya ti /
analyzed: bu 'dod pa'i bdag nyid ni /🔽pu tra k'a mya ti /
translated: is putrakāmyati.

original: shu bha k'a mya ti /
analyzed: shu bha k'a mya ti /
translated: Śubha kāmya ti.

original: las la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: las la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of karma?

original: a'atman:pu tre ne tstsha ti /
analyzed: a'atman:pu tre ne tstsha ti /

analyzed: spri ha 'dod pa la'o //

analyzed: gang gi yi ge ma yin pa de ni gcig min te /
translated: That which is not a single letter is not a single vowel.

original: 'gyur ba med cing g-yo ba med pa ni pha rol du rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes pa gzhan gyi brjod pa las yi ge'i sgras dbyangs brjod do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med cing g-yo ba med pa ni pha rol du rjes su 'gro ba med do zhes pa gzhan gyi brjod pa las yi ge'i sgras dbyangs brjod do //
translated: Since it is said by others that that which is unchanging and unmoving does not go to the other side, the term letter refers to the vowel.

original: mtha' na yod pa ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: mtha' na yod pa ni mtha' ste /
translated: The final is the end.

original: cha shas gang gi dbyangs dang po yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: cha shas gang gi dbyangs dang po yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The vowel that is the first part of a letter is to be connected with the word.

original: gang yi ge gcig ma yin pa te dbyangs gcig ma yin pa'i rtags kyi cha shas mtha'i dbyangs sogs de ni /
analyzed: gang yi ge gcig ma yin pa te dbyangs gcig ma yin pa'i rtags kyi cha shas mtha'i dbyangs sogs de ni /
translated: That which is not a single letter, that is, not a single vowel, is the vowel of the final part of the sign.

original: ain\ pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //🔽aa ti ha sta yi ta /🔽au pa b'i na ya ti ;
analyzed: ain\ pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro // aa ti ha sta yi ta / au pa b'i na ya ti ;
translated: The root iṇ means “to go to the other side.”🔽The root ati means “to cross over.”🔽The root upa means “to go near.”

original: aa ti ha stin\ dang au pa b'i n'a dag glang po'i shin tu skyod do //
analyzed: aa ti ha stin\ dang au pa b'i n'a dag glang po'i shin tu skyod do //
translated: The roots ati and upa mean “to cross over an elephant.”

original: b'i n'a sa nye bar 'gro'o zhes byings don la ain te k'a ri ta'o zhes pas ain 'o //
analyzed: b'i n'a sa nye bar 'gro'o zhes byings don la ain te k'a ri ta'o zhes pas ain 'o //
translated: The root iṇ means “to go near,” because of the word iṇtakāritaḥ.

original: 'dis mtha'i dbyings dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'dis mtha'i dbyings dbyi'o //
translated: This means “to cross over the final vowel.”

original: 'o na b'i n'a'i sgra'i mtha' dbyangs ma yin pa cung zad kyang med pas sogs dbyi'o zhes ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na b'i n'a'i sgra'i mtha' dbyangs ma yin pa cung zad kyang med pas sogs dbyi'o zhes ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: “But since the final sound of the root upa does not have any vowel at all, why is it said to be crossed over?”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: mtha'i dang po bzhin gcig la zhes pa'i tshig las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha'i dang po bzhin gcig la zhes pa'i tshig las 'gyur ro //
translated: “Like the first of the final.”

original: rtags kyi zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽tsa k'a sa ya ti /
analyzed: rtags kyi zhes pa ci zhe na / tsa k'a sa ya ti /
translated: What is the meaning of “the sign”?

original: tsa k'a sri gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: tsa k'a sri gsal ba la'o //
translated: The root cak means “to be clear.”

original: gsal bar gyur pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa la sbyor ro //
translated: It is applied to that which is clear.

original: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pas ain\ 'o //🔽yi ge gcig min @167a * //
analyzed: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pas ain\ 'o // yi ge gcig min @167a * //
translated: The root iṇ means “to go,” because of the word iṇakāraṇa.

original: pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: “Not a single letter” means what?

original: tva tsam gri hna ti /🔽tva tsa ya ti /
analyzed: tva tsam gri hna ti /🔽tva tsa ya ti /
translated: The root tvac means “to take.”🔽The root tvac means “to become.”

original: ain te ka ri ta'ang zhes bas aina'o //
analyzed: ain te ka ri ta'ang zhes bas aina'o //
translated: And the en of entakarita is elided.

original: dbyangs gcig ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la yi ge gcig ma yin pa smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbyangs gcig ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la yi ge gcig ma yin pa smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
translated: Not a single syllable is elided.

original: 'o na gong du ain smos pa'i don gyi dbang las rnam dbye yongs su gyur pa'o zhes pas bdun pa'i mtha' shes par byed pas de dang de'i don grub pas slar yang ci'i phyir ain smos she na /
analyzed: 'o na gong du ain smos pa'i don gyi dbang las rnam dbye yongs su gyur pa'o zhes pas bdun pa'i mtha' shes par byed pas de dang de'i don grub pas slar yang ci'i phyir ain smos she na /
translated: But if the case ending is changed by the power of the meaning of the en that was mentioned above, then the seventh case ending is understood. Since the meaning of that is established, why is en mentioned again?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: bya ba gzhan gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to clarify another action.

original: des na thu la dang dur dang yu b'an dang hra sva dang kshi pra dang kshu tra rnams kyi pha rol gyi mthar gnas sogs kyi cha shas ain pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thu la dang dur dang yu b'an dang hra sva dang kshi pra dang kshu tra rnams kyi pha rol gyi mthar gnas sogs kyi cha shas ain pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the en of thula, dur, yubhan, hrasva, ksipram, and kshudra is elided after the final letter of the preceding word.

original: n'a mi rnams kyi'ang yon tan no //
analyzed: n'a mi rnams kyi'ang yon tan no //
translated: And the na of naman.

original: sth'u lam bshad pa la ka ro ti /
analyzed: sth'u lam bshad pa la ka ro ti /
translated: In the explanation of sthaulam, karoti.

original: yang na stha ba ya ti /
analyzed: yang na stha ba ya ti /

original: ain te k'a ri ta 'ang ngo zhes pas aina'o //
analyzed: ain te k'a ri ta 'ang ngo zhes pas aina'o //
translated: And the en of entakarita is elided.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dur / da ba ya ti /
analyzed: dur / da ba ya ti /
translated: [The word] 'dur' [means] 'now'.

original: yu ba na ya ba ya ti /
analyzed: yu ba na ya ba ya ti /

original: hra sva ya ti /
analyzed: hra sva ya ti /

analyzed: kshi pra / kshe pa ya ti /

analyzed: ha sva ya ti /

analyzed: zhes pa 'dir re pha dang po'i cha shas mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gsal byed dang po can rita yang ba'i ra sgra'o //

analyzed: ri yig gang gi dang po gsal byed yin pa de ni gsal byed dang po can no //

analyzed: ain la zhes pa kho na'o //

analyzed: mtha'i dbyangs dang po dbyi'o zhes pa'ang ngo //

analyzed: gsal byed dang po can yang ba'i ri yig ni ain\ pha rol la ra sgra nyid du bsgyur bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: pri thu bshad pa la ka ro ti'o //

analyzed: yang na / pra tha ya ti /

analyzed: byings gang gi dbyangs gcig yin pa de ni dbyangs gcig pa'i'o //

analyzed: dbyangs gcig pa gsal byed dang po can gyis byings las bya ba yang dag par mngon par sdud par 'jug bzhin pa la ya sgra 'gyur te /

analyzed: ya dza lha mchod pa la'o //

analyzed: shu bha mdzes pa la'o //

analyzed: ru tsa gsal ba la'o //

original: sgra smos pa las /
analyzed: sgra smos pa las /

analyzed: s'u tsi dang s'u tri dang m'u tri dang aa ti dang ri dang aa shu dang a'utnunya rnams las kyang aa sgra 'dod do //

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /

original: cha shas rnams las gang aa yig la byas pa'i rtags de pan zhes pa 'di'i tshogs pa'i khyad par can du mi 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / pan'a ya'i sgra las 'khrul te gang gi phyir pa n'a'i sgra a'a ya'i rkyen gyi'o //

translated: The sign made from the letter a is not confused as a particular of the collection of the letters pa, ṇa, and ya, and it is not confused by the term paṇḍita, because the term paṇḍita is a condition of the term āya.

original: de ltar yang gang ba lang las byas pa'i rtags de ba lang kho na'i khyad par can te /
analyzed: de ltar yang gang ba lang las byas pa'i rtags de ba lang kho na'i khyad par can te /

original: de'i phyir / pa n'a ya ti /
analyzed: de'i phyir / pa n'a ya ti /

original: du bhrinya 'dzin pa dang rgyas par byed pa dag a'o //
analyzed: du bhrinya 'dzin pa dang rgyas par byed pa dag a'o //
translated: Dubhṛṇ is for holding and expanding.

original: hu sbyin pa dang len pa dag la'o //
analyzed: hu sbyin pa dang len pa dag la'o //
translated: Hu is for giving and taking.

original: 'di rnams las pa ro& ksha la a'am yang na 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di rnams las pa ro& ksha la a'am yang na 'gyur zhing /
translated: From these, the affix ṇ is added, or the affix ṅ is added.

original: de'ang a'ang gi rkyen la byings thams cad pa bzhin te /🔽byings thams cad pa la gang bshad pa'i dzu ho ti la sogs pa rnams kyi byings thams cad pa la'o //
analyzed: de'ang a'ang gi rkyen la byings thams cad pa bzhin te / byings thams cad pa la gang bshad pa'i dzu ho ti la sogs pa rnams kyi byings thams cad pa la'o //
translated: And that also, like all the roots, is for the condition of ṅ.🔽For all the roots, it is like what is explained for jūhoti and so on.🔽For all the roots of bī, hṛ, bhṛ, and hu, it is said that ṇ is for the condition of ṅ.

original: bhrinya hang mang rnams kyi aita'o zhes pa de a'a ma'i rkyan la'ang 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bhrinya hang mang rnams kyi aita'o zhes pa de a'a ma'i rkyan la'ang 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is also for the condition of ṅ.

original: bi bha y'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: bi bha y'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: Vibhāyaṃ cakāra.

original: dzi hra y'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: dzi hra y'am tsa k'a ra /

original: bi bha r'am tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: bi bha r'am tsa k'a ra /
translated: Vibhāreṇa cakāra.

original: dzu ha bam tsa k'a ra /
analyzed: dzu ha bam tsa k'a ra /
translated: Jūhena cakāra.

original: byings thams cad pa bzhin du 'gyur bas dzu ho ti la sogs pa rnams kyi byings thams cad pa la zhes pas lan gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: byings thams cad pa bzhin du 'gyur bas dzu ho ti la sogs pa rnams kyi byings thams cad pa la zhes pas lan gnyis brjod do //
translated: Since it is like all the roots, the two words of all the roots of Zhuhoti and so on are stated by the words of all the roots.🔽The short one.

original: thung ngu'o // gnyis pa bzhi pa dag gi zhes pas bh'a'i ba'o //
analyzed: thung ngu'o // gnyis pa bzhi pa dag gi zhes pas bh'a'i ba'o //
translated: The second and fourth are Bha and Va.

original: bhrinya hang m'ang rnams kyi aita'o zhes pas ai nyid do //
analyzed: bhrinya hang m'ang rnams kyi aita'o zhes pas ai nyid do //
translated: The Ai of Bhrin, Hang, and Mang is the Ai itself.🔽The A or Ai is Krin.

original: a'ama\'i krinya'o // phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: a'ama\'i krinya'o // phyogs gcig la /
translated: In one case,

original: bi bh'a ma ;
analyzed: bi bh'a ma ;
translated: Vibha.🔽Jiharaya.

original: dzihr'a ya / ba bh'a ra /
analyzed: dzihr'a ya / ba bh'a ra /
translated: Babhara.

original: dzu h'a ba /
analyzed: dzu h'a ba /
translated: Zhuhava.

original: aata'o // gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: aata'o // gnyis brjod do //
translated: The two words are stated.

original: aa'i yul pa dh'a zhes pas 'phel ba'o //🔽a'ama\'i krinya rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa'i yul pa dh'a zhes pas 'phel ba'o // a'ama\'i krinya rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The A and Ai of the country of A are increased.🔽A or Ai is to be added.

original: a'am\ mtha'i rjes su krinya'i byings sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: a'am\ mtha'i rjes su krinya'i byings sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: A or Ai is to be added after Krin.

original: phyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be added later.

original: nya rjes su 'brel pa ni byings nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: nya rjes su 'brel pa ni byings nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: The connection with Na is for the sake of understanding the root itself.

original: dper brjod pa rnams ni gong du byas zin pa rnams so //
analyzed: dper brjod pa rnams ni gong du byas zin pa rnams so //
translated: The examples are those done above.

original: aas\ bh'u dag kyang ste pa rasmee'o //
analyzed: aas\ bh'u dag kyang ste pa rasmee'o //
translated: The A and Bhu are also Parasmai.

original: pa rasmee'i tshig ces pa 'di'i dang po dbyi ba zhes pas dbyi'o //🔽a'ama mtha'i sgra'i rjes su byings aas dang bh'u zhes pa 'di dag sbyar bar bya zhing a'atma ne'i tshig gi 'ang gnas @171a * //
analyzed: pa rasmee'i tshig ces pa 'di'i dang po dbyi ba zhes pas dbyi'o // a'ama mtha'i sgra'i rjes su byings aas dang bh'u zhes pa 'di dag sbyar bar bya zhing a'atma ne'i tshig gi 'ang gnas @171a * //
translated: The word parasmai is the first word.

original: la pa rasmee'i tshig tu bsgyur ro //
analyzed: la pa rasmee'i tshig tu bsgyur ro //
translated: After the word aṃ, the verbal roots a and bhū are added, and the word parasmai is changed to the word ātmane.

original: 'dir a'atma ne'i tshig ces pa de dbyi bar blta bar bya'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'dir a'atma ne'i tshig ces pa de dbyi bar blta bar bya'o zhes smra'o //
translated: Here, the word ātmane is said to be seen as having the aṃ removed.

original: rnam par bshad pa las kyang de dbyi bar bya'o //🔽a'i ksha m'a sa /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa las kyang de dbyi bar bya'o // a'i ksha m'a sa /
translated: In the exposition, it is also said to have the aṃ removed.🔽Aikṣamāsa

original: a'i ksham ba bhu ba /
analyzed: a'i ksham ba bhu ba /
translated: Aikṣamāṃ bhū

original: a'iksha lta ba la'o //
analyzed: a'iksha lta ba la'o //
translated: Aikṣa means seeing.

original: ru tsa la sogs pa nyid las a'atma ne'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ru tsa la sogs pa nyid las a'atma ne'i tshig ste /
translated: The word ātmane is from the root ruci and so on.

original: pa ro& ksha'i ae'o //
analyzed: pa ro& ksha'i ae'o //
translated: The word parasmai is from the root kṣa.

original: n'a mi dang po lji ba ldan pa zhes pas aa ma\'o //
analyzed: n'a mi dang po lji ba ldan pa zhes pas aa ma\'o //
translated: The word nāma is from the root nam.

original: 'dis aas dang bhu dag rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis aas dang bhu dag rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: By this, a and bhū are added.

original: a'atma ne'i tshig ae yig pa rasmee'i tshig tu bsgyur te /🔽aa ta ru'o //
analyzed: a'atma ne'i tshig ae yig pa rasmee'i tshig tu bsgyur te / aa ta ru'o //
translated: The word ātmane is changed to the word parasmai.🔽Aikṣamāṃ bhū becomes aitaru.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: It is said twice.

original: dang po'i aa'i thams cad du'o zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: dang po'i aa'i thams cad du'o zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The first a is in all long [vowels].

original: bha ba ti'i aa'o //
analyzed: bha ba ti'i aa'o //
translated: The a is in bhavati.

original: gnyis pa bzhi pa dag gi zhes pas bha'i pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa bzhi pa dag gi zhes pas bha'i pa'o //
translated: The second and fourth [letters] are in bhava.🔽The u is in adhi.

original: aa dhi'i au pa dh'a zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: aa dhi'i au pa dh'a zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long [vowel] is in upadha.

original: ring po las pha rol dbyi'o //
analyzed: ring po las pha rol dbyi'o //
translated: The long [vowel] is in parā.🔽The va is in bhuta.

original: bh'u'i mtha'i zhes pas ba yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: bh'u'i mtha'i zhes pas ba yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The a is in agam.🔽The bhu is in all roots except asthi.

original: aasti'i byings thams cad pa ma yin pa la bh'u'o zhes pas aasti bh'u du bsgyur bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: aasti'i byings thams cad pa ma yin pa la bh'u'o zhes pas aasti bh'u du bsgyur bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, asthi is not changed to asthi bhu.

original: gal te 'gyur na aa sti gzung ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na aa sti gzung ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, the asthi would be meaningless.

original: kyang gi sgra ni pa rasmee'i bar mchad rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni pa rasmee'i bar mchad rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word also is to be understood up to parasmim.

original: de'ang rjes su thob pa las so //
analyzed: de'ang rjes su thob pa las so //
translated: Moreover, it is from the subsequent [state].

original: des na gang yang pa rasmee'i tshig tu bsgyur ba med pa de la yang aas\ dang bh'u dang rjes su sbyar ro //🔽tsa k'a s'a m'a sa /
analyzed: des na gang yang pa rasmee'i tshig tu bsgyur ba med pa de la yang aas\ dang bh'u dang rjes su sbyar ro // tsa k'a s'a m'a sa /
translated: Therefore, even where the word parasmim is not changed, as and bhu are added.🔽cakāsāma

original: tsa k'a s'am ba bhu ba /
analyzed: tsa k'a s'am ba bhu ba /
translated: cakāsambhu

original: tsa k'a sri gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: tsa k'a sri gsal ba la'o //
translated: cakāsri is in the clear.🔽at

original: aata'o // tsak'asra dang kas zhes pas a'a ma'o//
analyzed: aata'o // tsak'asra dang kas zhes pas a'a ma'o//
translated: cakāsri and ka are in āma.

original: aas\ dang bh'u dag rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: aas\ dang bh'u dag rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The roots as and bhū are added.

original: gzhan snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: auta bida dz'a gri rnams las yang na'o zhes pas yang na 'jug ste de yang rnam par bshad pa la'o //
analyzed: auta bida dz'a gri rnams las yang na'o zhes pas yang na 'jug ste de yang rnam par bshad pa la'o //
translated: From u, vid, and ja, grī, the suffix yaṅ is added.

original: des na dngos po dang las dag gi a'atma ne'i tshig gi pa rasmee'i tshig tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na dngos po dang las dag gi a'atma ne'i tshig gi pa rasmee'i tshig tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the words ātmanepada of nouns and verbal roots are not words of parasmaipada.

original: a'i ksha m'a se /🔽a'iksham ba bhu be /
analyzed: a'i ksha m'a se / a'iksham ba bhu be /
translated: The root aksa means🔽to see.

original: aa dya ta bida dza gri la si tsa'o //
analyzed: aa dya ta bida dza gri la si tsa'o //
translated: The root adya means to know.

original: byings las aa dya t'a ni pha rol la si tsa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //🔽ai yig dang tsa yig dag ni si tsa la pa rasmee la'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byings las aa dya t'a ni pha rol la si tsa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro // ai yig dang tsa yig dag ni si tsa la pa rasmee la'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: From the root adya, the suffix si is added.🔽The letters i and ca are for si and parasmaipada.

original: aa k'arsha ti /🔽aa h'arsh'i ta /
analyzed: aa k'arsha ti / aa h'arsh'i ta /
translated: The root akarsati means🔽to draw.🔽The root aharsati means

original: aa tseesha ti /
analyzed: aa tseesha ti /
translated: to take away.🔽The root acchati means🔽to drink.

original: aa nee shi ta /🔽du krinya byed pa la'o //🔽hrinya 'phrog pa la'o //
analyzed: aa nee shi ta / du krinya byed pa la'o // hrinya 'phrog pa la'o //
translated: The root neṣṭi means🔽to lead.🔽The root duṣkri means to do.

original: tsinya sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: tsinya sogs pa la'o //
translated: The root hṛṇ means to steal.🔽The root cin means to collect.

original: ninya thob pa la'o ;🔽/ aa dya t'a ni'i di'o //
analyzed: ninya thob pa la'o ; / aa dya t'a ni'i di'o //
translated: The root ni means to obtain.🔽The root adhyā means to know.

original: 'dis si tsa'o //
analyzed: 'dis si tsa'o //
translated: This is si.

original: si tsa la pa ra smee'i la'o zhes pas 'phel ba ste a'ara dang aee'o //🔽si tsa las zhes pas a'ita'o //
analyzed: si tsa la pa ra smee'i la'o zhes pas 'phel ba ste a'ara dang aee'o // si tsa las zhes pas a'ita'o //
translated: The augment is added to the root with the addition of a.🔽The augment is added to the root with the addition of a.

original: rdzogs pa la yang na'o zhes pas da'i ta'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa la yang na'o zhes pas da'i ta'o //
translated: The augment is added to the root with the addition of a.🔽abheṣṭi

original: aa bheetsh'i ta /🔽aatstsheetsh'ita / bi dir rnam par 'byed pa la'o //
analyzed: aa bheetsh'i ta / aatstsheetsh'ita / bi dir rnam par 'byed pa la'o //
translated: accheṣṭi🔽vidir means to divide.

original: tstshi dir gnyis su byed /🔽@171b sitsa'o // gsal byed mtha' rnams kyi aita med ba'i zhes pas 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: tstshi dir gnyis su byed / @171b sitsa'o // gsal byed mtha' rnams kyi aita med ba'i zhes pas 'phel ba'o //
translated: cchidir means to divide in two.🔽sitsa means to shine.🔽The augment is added to the final consonants without the addition of i.

original: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa rnams kyi dang po'o zhes pas da'i ta'o //🔽aa kri ta /
analyzed: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa rnams kyi dang po'o zhes pas da'i ta'o // aa kri ta /
translated: The augment is added to the first of the non-aspirated ones.🔽akṛta🔽ahṛta

original: aa hrita / aa dya ta n'i ta'o //
analyzed: aa hrita / aa dya ta n'i ta'o //
translated: adyatanīti

original: thung ngu las kyang aita med pa'i si tsa dbyi'o //
analyzed: thung ngu las kyang aita med pa'i si tsa dbyi'o //
translated: The augment is added to the short ones without the addition of i.

original: aita med pa shit\ mtha' n'a mi au pa dh'a can dri sha ma yin pa las sana'o //
analyzed: aita med pa shit\ mtha' n'a mi au pa dh'a can dri sha ma yin pa las sana'o //
translated: The augment is added to the non-aspirated final ones without the addition of i.

original: byings gang la aita yod pa ma yin pa de ni aita med pa'o //
analyzed: byings gang la aita yod pa ma yin pa de ni aita med pa'o //
translated: The root that does not have i is without i.

original: gang gi mtha' shita yin pa de ni shita mtha'o //
analyzed: gang gi mtha' shita yin pa de ni shita mtha'o //
translated: The one that has śita at the end is with śita at the end.

original: gang gi au pa dh'a n'a mi yin pa de ni n'a mi au pa dh'a can te /
analyzed: gang gi au pa dh'a n'a mi yin pa de ni n'a mi au pa dh'a can te /
translated: That which has upadhānam is upadhācin.

original: dri sha ma yin pa'i'o //
analyzed: dri sha ma yin pa'i'o //
translated: Not driśa.

original: byings aita med cing shita mtha' n'a mi au pa dh'a can dri sha ma yin pa ste dri sha dor ba las aa dya ta n'i pha rol la san 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byings aita med cing shita mtha' n'a mi au pa dh'a can dri sha ma yin pa ste dri sha dor ba las aa dya ta n'i pha rol la san 'gyur ro //
translated: The root i is not followed by upadhācin, and not by driśa. The i is dropped, and san is added to the end of the word.

original: sitsa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: sitsa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: Sits means to block.

original: aa bi kshat\/ aa kri kshat\/
analyzed: aa bi kshat\/ aa kri kshat\/
translated: Avakṣat, akṣat,

original: au dhu kshat\/ bi sha rab tu 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: au dhu kshat\/ bi sha rab tu 'jug pa la'o //
translated: udakṣat, viśa means to enter.

original: krish\ rko ba la'o //
analyzed: krish\ rko ba la'o //
translated: Kṛṣ means to dig.

original: du ha 'jo ba la'o //🔽di'o // ri shi /🔽tu shi / tvi shi /
analyzed: du ha 'jo ba la'o // di'o // ri shi / tu shi / tvi shi /
translated: Duh means to carry.

original: sushya ti / da hi zhes pas aita med do //
analyzed: sushya ti / da hi zhes pas aita med do //
translated: The root i is not followed by upadhācin.

original: sa na'o // na yig ni ;
analyzed: sa na'o // na yig ni ;
translated: San. The letter na

original: na rjes su 'brel pa la ma yin zhes pa'i don to //🔽bi sha la tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
analyzed: na rjes su 'brel pa la ma yin zhes pa'i don to // bi sha la tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
translated: means that the na is not connected.🔽Viśa has śa and sa.

original: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //🔽du ha'i / da dang po'i gha'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o // du ha'i / da dang po'i gha'o //
translated: Śa and dha have sa and ka.🔽Duh has da and first gha.

original: gsum pa dang po'i gha'o zhes pas da'i dh'a'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang po'i gha'o zhes pas da'i dh'a'o //
translated: The third and first gha have dha and dha.

original: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa zhes pas gha'i ka nyid do //
analyzed: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa zhes pas gha'i ka nyid do //
translated: In the case of those that are not vocal, the gha is the same as the ka.

original: sha nyid do //🔽aa ru kshat\/ aa li ksha ta /
analyzed: sha nyid do // aa ru kshat\/ aa li ksha ta /
translated: The śa is the same as the sa.🔽The ru is the same as the ru.

original: ru ha b'idza sna la ma'i rgyun la'o //
analyzed: ru ha b'idza sna la ma'i rgyun la'o //
translated: The va is the same as the va.

original: liha ro myang ba la'o //
analyzed: liha ro myang ba la'o //
translated: The li is the same as the li.

original: di'o // sana'o //
analyzed: di'o // sana'o //
translated: The di is the same as the di.🔽The hi is the same as the hi.

original: ha'i dha'o // sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: ha'i dha'o // sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
translated: The śa is the same as the sa.

original: aita med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aita med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “without i”?

original: aa ko sh'i ta /
analyzed: aa ko sh'i ta /
translated: The a is the same as the a.

original: ku sha gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: ku sha gnas pa la'o //
translated: The ku is the same as the ku.

original: di'o // sitsa'o //
analyzed: di'o // sitsa'o //
translated: The di is the same as the di.🔽The si is the same as the si.

original: aita'i a'ita'o // aita las kyang a'ita la zhes pas sitsa dbyi'o //
analyzed: aita'i a'ita'o // aita las kyang a'ita la zhes pas sitsa dbyi'o //
translated: The ai is the same as the ai.

original: n'a mi'i'ang au pa dh'a'i'o zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: n'a mi'i'ang au pa dh'a'i'o zhes pas yon tan no //
translated: The na is the same as the upa°.

original: shita mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: shita mtha' las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “at the end of śita”?

original: aa bhatsh'a ti /
analyzed: aa bhatsh'a ti /
translated: The a is the same as the a.

original: n'a mi au pa dh'a can las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: n'a mi au pa dh'a can las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “from na with upa°”?

original: aa dh'a kshita /
analyzed: aa dh'a kshita /
translated: The a is the same as the a.

original: da ha thal bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: da ha thal bar byed pa la'o //
translated: The da is the same as the da.

original: di'o // si tsa'o //🔽aa'i ga ring po'o //
analyzed: di'o // si tsa'o // aa'i ga ring po'o //
translated: The di is the same as the di.🔽The ai is the same as the ai.

original: da dang po'i gha'o //
analyzed: da dang po'i gha'o //
translated: The da is the same as the gha.

original: gsum pa dang po'i bha dha dha bha zhes pas da'i dha'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang po'i bha dha dha bha zhes pas da'i dha'o //
translated: The third is the same as the first. The bha is the same as the dha.

original: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa zhes pas ka'o //
translated: For those without a vowel, not shit means k.

original: a'ita'o // dri sha ma yin pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: a'ita'o // dri sha ma yin pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: Aiṭa. Not smell means what?

original: aa dr'a kshi ta /
analyzed: aa dr'a kshi ta /
translated: Adrakṣita.

original: dri shir lta ba la'o //
analyzed: dri shir lta ba la'o //
translated: Smell is seen.🔽 Diṭa.

original: di'o // sitsa'o //
analyzed: di'o // sitsa'o //
translated: Sits.

original: sridzi dri sha dag gi a'a ga ma'o zhes pas aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: sridzi dri sha dag gi a'a ga ma'o zhes pas aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The ā of the two, sṛ and ḍṛ, means the ā of a.

original: ra nyid do //
analyzed: ra nyid do //
translated: Ra itself.

original: 'ang ring po'o //🔽cha sha dag gis 'ang ngo zhes pas sha 'o //
analyzed: 'ang ring po'o // cha sha dag gis 'ang ngo zhes pas sha 'o //
translated: Also long.🔽By the two, śa and ṣa, means śa.

original: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
translated: Śadha. On the sa of the two, means ka.

original: gu hi'i aita med pa'i phyogs las san bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gu hi'i aita med pa'i phyogs las san bshad par bya ste /
translated: Guhi. The side without ita is explained as san.

original: auda rjes su 'brel pa nyid las 'di'i rnam par brtag pas aita yod do zhes pas thob pa ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: auda rjes su 'brel pa nyid las 'di'i rnam par brtag pas aita yod do zhes pas thob pa ma yin pa la'o //
translated: U. Because of the connection, means that because of the analysis of this, ita exists. Not obtained means🔽 Aghaukṣita.

original: aa ghukshata / gu hu yang dag par sgrib pa la'o //
analyzed: aa ghukshata / gu hu yang dag par sgrib pa la'o //
translated: Guhu. Concealment means🔽 Diṭa.

original: di'o // san te bshad pa las so //
analyzed: di'o // san te bshad pa las so //
translated: San. From the explanation means🔽 Haiḍha.

original: ha'i dha'o // gsum pa dang po'i gha dha bha mtha'i zhes pas ga'i gha'o //
analyzed: ha'i dha'o // gsum pa dang po'i gha dha bha mtha'i zhes pas ga'i gha'o //
translated: The third and first, gha, dha, ba, and the end, means gha.

original: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
translated: The ka of the śad group is for kā.

original: a'a shli sha'i 'khyud pa'i don la san bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: a'a shli sha'i 'khyud pa'i don la san bshad par bya ste /
translated: The sa of the śad group is for saṃ, which is explained as embracing.

original: pusha sogs las aan thob pa la'o //
analyzed: pusha sogs las aan thob pa la'o //
translated: The a of the puśa group is for an, which is for obtaining.

original: a'a sh'ikshanna yi k'a de ba datta /
analyzed: a'a sh'ikshanna yi k'a de ba datta /
translated: The a of the śikṣa group is for aṇ, which is for devadatta.

original: shlisha kun du med pa la'o //
analyzed: shlisha kun du med pa la'o //
translated: The a of the śliṣa group is for a, which is for non-existence.

original: a'ang snga mar ro //
analyzed: a'ang snga mar ro //
translated: The a of the aśi group is for a, which is for former.

original: nga yig ni pa ri aa pa aang sbyor ba la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nga yig ni pa ri aa pa aang sbyor ba la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The a of the aṅga group is for aṅ, which is for connection.

original: sha dha dag gi ka'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi ka'o //
translated: The ka of the śad group is for ka.

original: 'khyud pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'khyud pa zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: sa m'a sh'i shadzdza tu k'ashtanytsa /
analyzed: sa m'a sh'i shadzdza tu k'ashtanytsa /
translated: The a of the samāśi group is for aṃ, which is for embracing.

original: sam a'ang snga mar ro //🔽sh'isha'i pu sha sogs kyi mdos aana'o //🔽spri shi dang mri shi kri sha rnams las san yang na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sam a'ang snga mar ro // sh'isha'i pu sha sogs kyi mdos aana'o // spri shi dang mri shi kri sha rnams las san yang na bshad par bya ste /
translated: The a of the aśi group is for a, which is for former.🔽The a of the puśa group is for an, which is for obtaining.🔽The sa of the spṛśa group is for sa, which is for touching.

original: aaspri kshat / spriksha reg pa la'o //🔽sana'o // tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
analyzed: aaspri kshat / spriksha reg pa la'o // sana'o // tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pas sha'o //
translated: The a of the śaśa group is for a, which is for former.

original: sha dha dag gi ka'o //🔽sha nyid do //🔽phyogs gcig la si tsa ste /
analyzed: sha dha dag gi ka'o // sha nyid do // phyogs gcig la si tsa ste /
translated: The ka of the śad group is for ka.🔽 The a of the śaśa group is for a, which is for former.

original: aaspr'a kshita / aa sp'arsh'i ra /
analyzed: aaspr'a kshita / aa sp'arsh'i ra /
translated: The ci of the śaśa group is for ci, which is for one side.🔽The a of the aśi group is for a, which is for former.

original: sitsa'o // bshad ba las yang na aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: sitsa'o // bshad ba las yang na aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: Or, in the explanation, the letter A is the augment.

original: aa'i 'ang ring po'o //
analyzed: aa'i 'ang ring po'o //
translated: The letter A is also long.

original: ra nyid do //
analyzed: ra nyid do //
translated: R is itself.

original: phyogs gcig la a'a gam\ med cing gsal byed mtha' rnams kyi aita med pa'i zhes pas 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la a'a gam\ med cing gsal byed mtha' rnams kyi aita med pa'i zhes pas 'phel ba'o //
translated: In one part, the letter A is not the augment, and the final consonants do not have the iṭ vowel (is the augment).

original: sitsa la zhes pas a'ita'o //
analyzed: sitsa la zhes pas a'ita'o //
translated: In SICT, the letter iṭ (is the augment).

original: snga ma bzhin du sha nyid dang ka nyid dag go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sha nyid dang ka nyid dag go //
translated: As before, the letter Ṣ is itself, and the letter K is itself.

original: aa mrikshat\/ aa mr'akshit /
analyzed: aa mrikshat\/ aa mr'akshit /
translated: AMRIKṢTA, AMARAKṢIT,

original: aa m'arksh'i ta /🔽aa kri kshata /
analyzed: aa m'arksh'i ta / aa kri kshata /
translated: AMĀRAKṢĪTA,🔽 AKRIKṢTA, AKARAKṢĪTA.

original: aa kr'aksh'ita / mrisha bzod pa la'o //
analyzed: aa kr'aksh'ita / mrisha bzod pa la'o //
translated: MṚṢ means to endure.

original: krisha 'bri ba la'o //
analyzed: krisha 'bri ba la'o //
translated: KṚṢ means to write.

original: di'o // sana'o //
analyzed: di'o // sana'o //
translated: DI means this, and SA means that.

original: gang la ai yig yod pa de la si tsa'o //
analyzed: gang la ai yig yod pa de la si tsa'o //
translated: Where there is the letter I, there is SICT.

original: si tsa'i phyogs la bshad pa las aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: si tsa'i phyogs la bshad pa las aa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: In the part of SICT, the letter A is the augment.

original: sha nyid do //
analyzed: sha nyid do //
translated: The letter Ṣ is itself.

original: snga ma bzhin du sha'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sha'o //
translated: As before, the letter Ṣ is itself.

original: de bzhin du ring po 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ring po 'phel ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the long (vowels) increase.

original: phyogs gcig la a'a ga ma med do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la a'a ga ma med do //
translated: In one part, the letter A is not the augment.🔽

original: du hi dang di hi dang li hi dang gu hi rnams las aa dya ta n'i'i a'atma ne'i tshig can dang po pha rol la san yang na 'jig par bshad par bya'o //🔽aa dugdha / aa dhukshata /
analyzed: du hi dang di hi dang li hi dang gu hi rnams las aa dya ta n'i'i a'atma ne'i tshig can dang po pha rol la san yang na 'jig par bshad par bya'o // aa dugdha / aa dhukshata /
translated: From duhi, dihi, lihi, and guhi, the first, having the word ātmane of ādyatanī, should be explained as “destruction” for the other.🔽aduḥkham, adhukṣat,

original: aa digdha / aa dhikshata /
analyzed: aa digdha / aa dhikshata /
translated: adiṅkham, adhiṅkṣat,

original: du ha 'jo ba la'o //
analyzed: du ha 'jo ba la'o //
translated: duhi means “to cook.”

original: di ha sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: di ha sogs pa la'o //
translated: dihi and so on.

original: aa dya ta n'i'i a'atma ne la san yang @172b na 'jig go //
analyzed: aa dya ta n'i'i a'atma ne la san yang @172b na 'jig go //
translated: In ādyatanī ātmane, san is also destruction.

original: da dang po'i gha'o //🔽gha dha dha bha zhes pas ta'i dha'o //
analyzed: da dang po'i gha'o // gha dha dha bha zhes pas ta'i dha'o //
translated: da is the first gha.🔽gha, dha, dha, bha is the third dha.

original: dhuta rnams kyi gsum pa'o zhes pas gha'i ga'o //
analyzed: dhuta rnams kyi gsum pa'o zhes pas gha'i ga'o //
translated: The third of the dhuts is said to be the ga of gha.

original: 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la gsum pa dang po'i gha dhadha bha mtha'i zhes pas da'i dha'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la gsum pa dang po'i gha dhadha bha mtha'i zhes pas da'i dha'o //
translated: In the case of non-destruction, the third is the first gha, dha, dha, bha, and the end is said to be the dha.

original: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa zhes pas gha'i ka'o //
analyzed: sgra med pa rnams la shita ma yin pa zhes pas gha'i ka'o //
translated: In the case of the non-voiced ones, it is not śita, and therefore the ka of gha.

original: sha nyid do //
analyzed: sha nyid do //
translated: It is śa itself.

original: aa'i dha / aa likshata /
analyzed: aa'i dha / aa likshata /

original: li ha za ba la'o //
analyzed: li ha za ba la'o //

original: di'o // san yang na 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: di'o // san yang na 'jig pa ma yin no //

original: ha'i dha'o zhes pas ha'i dha'o //
analyzed: ha'i dha'o zhes pas ha'i dha'o //
translated: ha is the dha, and therefore the dha of ha.

original: snga ma bzhin ta'i dha'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin ta'i dha'o //

original: sha dang ta sde'i ta sde zhes pas dha'i dha'o //
analyzed: sha dang ta sde'i ta sde zhes pas dha'i dha'o //

original: dha'i dha la phyis pa na au pa dh'a ring po yang ngo //
analyzed: dha'i dha la phyis pa na au pa dh'a ring po yang ngo //

original: 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la ha'i dha'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la ha'i dha'o //

original: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //
analyzed: sha dha dag gi sa la ka'o zhes pas ka'o //

original: de bzhin du /🔽aa g'u dha /
analyzed: de bzhin du / aa g'u dha /

original: aa ghuksha ta /
analyzed: aa ghuksha ta /

analyzed: gu hu yang dag par sgrib pa la'o //

analyzed: shri dru sru ka mi ka ri ta'i mtha' rnams las byed pa po la tsana'o //

analyzed: gang rnams kyi mtha' k'a ri ta yin pa de rnams ni ka ri ta'i mtha'o //

analyzed: zlas dbye ba'o //

analyzed: ka mu mdzes pa la'o //

analyzed: sitsa 'gog pa'o //

original: patha klog pa la'o //
analyzed: patha klog pa la'o //
translated: [The affix] ṭha is added to the root in the sense of reading.

original: byed du 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: byed du 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: [The affix] ṇi is added to the root in the sense of causing to do.

original: 'phrog tu 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'phrog tu 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: [The affix] ṇi is added to the root in the sense of causing to steal.

original: klog tu 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: klog tu 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: [The affix] ṇi is added to the root in the sense of causing to read.

analyzed: byings las kyang rgyu la'o zhes pas aina\'o //

analyzed: aa'i au padh'a zhes pas 'phel ba dang ring po'o // aa dya ta n'i'i di'o //

analyzed: tsana'o // k'a ri ta'i a'am\ aita bi k'a ra na zhes pas ka ri ta dbyi'o //

original: ain dang @173a * //
analyzed: ain dang @173a * //

original: tsan la zhes thung ngu'o //
analyzed: tsan la zhes thung ngu'o //
translated: [The affix] ṇi is added to the root in the sense of short, because of [the rule] “ṇi for i and u.”

original: gnyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis brjod par bya'o //

original: ri'i yi ge aa yig go //
analyzed: ri'i yi ge aa yig go //

analyzed: ka sde'i tsa sde'o // ha'i dza'o // mtshungs pa ma phyis na zhes pas ai nyid do //

analyzed: yang ba'i ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o // aa tsi ka mata / ka mu mdzes / ain te bshad pa las so //
translated: The long [vowel] is stated, because of [the rule] “the long of ā.”

original: aa'i au pa dh'a zhes pas ring po'o //🔽aa dya ta n'i'i a'atma ne'i ta'o //
analyzed: aa'i au pa dh'a zhes pas ring po'o // aa dya ta n'i'i a'atma ne'i ta'o //
translated: The long [vowel] is stated, because of [the rule] “the long of ā.”🔽The letter ṇi is the letter ṇi.

original: tsana'o // k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
analyzed: tsana'o // k'a ri ta dbyi'o //
translated: The letter ṇi is the letter ṇi.

original: thams cad sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad sngon bzhin no //
translated: Everything is as before.

analyzed: aas yod pa la'o //

analyzed: aa sti'i bhu'o zhes pas bhu ru bsgyur ro //

analyzed: aa la pi ta /

analyzed: aa si tsa ta /

analyzed: a'a hva ta /

analyzed: aa dya ta n'i'i aatma ne'i tshig ta'o //

analyzed: aana'o // snga ma bzhin a'a dbyi'o //

original: phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la /

original: aa lipta / aa sikta /
analyzed: aa lipta / aa sikta /

analyzed: a'a hvasta / si tsa la dhuta'i yang dhuta la dbyi'o //

original: tsa sde'i ki'o //
analyzed: tsa sde'i ki'o //

original: pusha sogs dhyu ta sogs li yig rjes su 'brel pa aarti sarti shasti rnams las kyang pa rasmee la'o //
analyzed: pusha sogs dhyu ta sogs li yig rjes su 'brel pa aarti sarti shasti rnams las kyang pa rasmee la'o //
translated: From arati, sarati, and sasti, also the suffix -pa is added.

original: gang rnams kyi dang po pusha yin pa de ni pusha sogs rnams so //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi dang po pusha yin pa de ni pusha sogs rnams so //
translated: Those that have pusha as the first letter are the pusha-group.

original: de bzhin du dyu ta sogs rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dyu ta sogs rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the dyutha-group.

original: de ltar li yig rjes su 'brel pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar li yig rjes su 'brel pa rnams so //

original: aarti zhes pa ni ri 'gro ba dang thob pa dag la'o //
analyzed: aarti zhes pa ni ri 'gro ba dang thob pa dag la'o //
translated: Arati means to go to the mountain and to obtain.

original: ri sri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa gnyis gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: ri sri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa gnyis gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The two, ri and sri, to go, should be taken.

original: rnam 'gyur gyi dngos po nyid nye bar bstan pa las so //
analyzed: rnam 'gyur gyi dngos po nyid nye bar bstan pa las so //
translated: Because the state of transformation is taught.

original: de bzhin du sarti zhes pa ni sri 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sarti zhes pa ni sri 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Similarly, sarati means to go to the mountain.

original: ri sri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: ri sri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa gzung ngo //
translated: The two, ri and sri, to go, are taken.

original: sh'asti zhes pa sha su rjes su ston pa la'o //
analyzed: sh'asti zhes pa sha su rjes su ston pa la'o //
translated: Shasti means to teach.

original: push sogs rnams dang dyu ta sogs rnams dang li yig rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang aarta sarti shasti zhes zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: push sogs rnams dang dyu ta sogs rnams dang li yig rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang aarta sarti shasti zhes zlas dbye'o //
translated: The pusha-group, the dyutha-group, those that have the suffix li, and arati, sarati, and sasti are distinguished.

original: pa rasmee'i tshig ces pa'i tshig phyis par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa rasmee'i tshig ces pa'i tshig phyis par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: push sogs rnams dang dyu ta sogs rnams dang li yig rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang aarti dang sarti dang shasti'i byings rnams las aan 'gyur te byed pa po brjod pa'i aa dya ta n'i'i pa rasmee'i tshig pha rol la'o ;
translated: The augment an is added to the roots puś and so forth, dyut and so forth, those that are connected with the letter li, and the roots arati, sarati, and śaśati, in the sense of the agent, in the word parasmāt, which is the third person.

original: / si tsa dang sana tsana 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: / si tsa dang sana tsana 'gegs pa'o //

original: di ba sogs can gyi pu sha gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: di ba sogs can gyi pu sha gzung bar bya'o //

original: bhu la sogs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: bhu la sogs pa can ma yin te /
translated: It is not bhū and so forth,

original: dhyu ta sogs las tha dad du smos pa las so //
analyzed: dhyu ta sogs las tha dad du smos pa las so //

original: dyu ta sogs rnams ni bhu sogs can gyi pu sha sogs kyi nang gi yan lag nyid do //
analyzed: dyu ta sogs rnams ni bhu sogs can gyi pu sha sogs kyi nang gi yan lag nyid do //
translated: Dyut and so forth are just the internal members of puś and so forth, which have bhū and so forth.

original: pusha sogs rnams las /
analyzed: pusha sogs rnams las /
translated: From puś and so forth,

original: aa pushata / aa tu shata /
analyzed: aa pushata / aa tu shata /
translated: apupus, apupust.

original: shu sha skams /
analyzed: shu sha skams /
translated: Śuśa is dry.

original: tusha dga' ba /
analyzed: tusha dga' ba /
translated: Tuś is joy.🔽Di is this.

original: di'o // aana'o //
analyzed: di'o // aana'o //
translated: An is that.

analyzed: a'a ga ma med pa'i zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: By the rule “There is no āgama” (anāgama), the long vowel.

original: te'o // aanbi /
analyzed: te'o // aanbi /
translated: and Teu.🔽🔽

original: aa dang mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa dang mtshams sbyor gyi yi ge dbyi'o //

original: a'a yi'i mtha' las kyang ngo //
analyzed: a'a yi'i mtha' las kyang ngo //
translated: From the end of ā and i, also.

original: a'a yi'i rkyen gyi mtha' las byed pa po'i don la a'atma ne'i tshig rnams 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'a yi'i rkyen gyi mtha' las byed pa po'i don la a'atma ne'i tshig rnams 'gyur ro //
translated: From the end of the condition ā and i, the words ātmanepada are changed to the meaning of the agent.

original: pandi t'a ya te /
analyzed: pandi t'a ya te /
translated: paṇḍitāyate.

original: bahma n'a ya te /
analyzed: bahma n'a ya te /
translated: bhavanāyate.

original: mkhas pa bzhin du kun du spyod do //
analyzed: mkhas pa bzhin du kun du spyod do //
translated: He behaves like a scholar.

original: bram ze bzhin du kun du spyod do zhes byed pa po la a'a yi zhes pas a'a yi'o //
analyzed: bram ze bzhin du kun du spyod do zhes byed pa po la a'a yi zhes pas a'a yi'o //
translated: He behaves like a brahmin. By the rule “āyī is the affix for the agent” (āyī kartari), āyī.

original: ai yig 'di'i don to //
analyzed: ai yig 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this letter i.

original: ain dang nya dang @179b yadza sogs las gnyis ka'o //
analyzed: ain dang nya dang @179b yadza sogs las gnyis ka'o //
translated: From iṇ, nya, yaj, and so on, both.

original: yadza dang 'dra ba ni yadza sogs so //
analyzed: yadza dang 'dra ba ni yadza sogs so //
translated: Like yaj, yaj and so on.

original: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Then the compound.

original: ain'i mtha' dang nya yig rjes su 'brel pa'i mtha' dang yadza sogs rnams gnyis ka ste /
analyzed: ain'i mtha' dang nya yig rjes su 'brel pa'i mtha' dang yadza sogs rnams gnyis ka ste /
translated: The end of iṇa, the end connected with the letter nya, and the ya-j-a-s-a-s are both.

original: pa rasmee'i tshig dang a'atma ne'i tshig kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa rasmee'i tshig dang a'atma ne'i tshig kyang 'gyur te /
translated: The word parasmāt and the word ātman also change.

original: byed pa po'i don la ya dzi sogs te ;
analyzed: byed pa po'i don la ya dzi sogs te ;
translated: The meaning of the agent is ya-j-a-s-a-s.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni rnam pa la'o //
translated: The word “etc.” is for the forms.

original: rnam pa ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'dra ba'o //

original: des na yadza sogs rnams ni ya dza dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na yadza sogs rnams ni ya dza dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the ya-j-a-s-a-s are to be expressed as similar to ya-j-a.

original: byings de rnams las gnyis ka 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byings de rnams las gnyis ka 'gyur ro //

original: aina'i mtha' las /🔽p'a tha ya ti /
analyzed: aina'i mtha' las / p'a tha ya ti /

original: p'a tha ya te /🔽bh'a ba ya ti /
analyzed: p'a tha ya te / bh'a ba ya ti /
translated: pāthāya-te🔽bhāvayā-ti

original: bh'a ba ya te /
analyzed: bh'a ba ya te /
translated: bhāvayā-te

original: klog tu 'jug pa po la sbyor ro //
analyzed: klog tu 'jug pa po la sbyor ro //
translated: is applied to the one who makes read.

original: de bzhin du yod pa po la zhes aina'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa po la zhes aina'o //
translated: Similarly, “to the existent” is iṇa.

original: aa'i au pa dh'a zhes pas ring po dang 'phel ba yang ngo //
analyzed: aa'i au pa dh'a zhes pas ring po dang 'phel ba yang ngo //
translated: By “ā of aupadhi” [the long and augment are also].

original: 'dis ti dang te'o //
analyzed: 'dis ti dang te'o //
translated: This is ti and te.

original: aanbi / yon tan no //
analyzed: aanbi / yon tan no //
translated: anvi, quality.

original: nya rjes su 'brel pa las /
analyzed: nya rjes su 'brel pa las /
translated: From nya connected:

original: ka ro ti /
analyzed: ka ro ti /
translated: karotī

original: ku ru te /
analyzed: ku ru te /
translated: kurute

original: du krinya byed pa la'o //
analyzed: du krinya byed pa la'o //
translated: dukriṇi, for doing.

original: tan sogs las au'o //
analyzed: tan sogs las au'o //
translated: au from taṃ and so on.

original: ka ro ti'i 'ang ngo zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: ka ro ti'i 'ang ngo zhes pas yon tan no //

original: aa'i au yig ces pas au nyid do //
analyzed: aa'i au yig ces pas au nyid do //
